extraction_metadata.article_title: Service-Centric Business Model in Cloud Environment

extracted_data.question_text: What is the name and definition of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Service-Centric Business Model in Cloud Environment - A cloud-enabled business model that describes the relatively stable logics of enterprises to do their business to create value for both customers and themselves in new business ecosystems based on cloud environment, transforming from product-centric to service-centric, value-oriented, and customer-based business models.
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Abstract: 'presents a specific service-centric business model' | Page 2, Section II: 'Cloud Business Model (short for CBM) is the cloud enabled BM which describes the relatively stable logics of enterprises to do their business to create value for both customers and themselves in the new business ecosystems based on cloud environment.' | Page 3, Section II: 'The CBM accelerates the appearance of the new networked business ecosystem and forces enterprises to redesign their existing business logics to improve their running businesses.'

extracted_data.question_text: What synonyms or alternative terms are used in the article to refer to this software business model?
extracted_value: Cloud Business Model
CBM
service-centric BM
cloud enabled BM
service-oriented BM
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2, Section II: 'Cloud Business Model (short for CBM) is the cloud enabled BM' | Page 3, Section II: 'Table I, Table II and table III also manifest that the CBM is a service centric BM.' | Page 1, Keywords: 'service-oriented; services centric'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the main vertical segment or industry where the software business model presented in the article is applied?
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Abstract: 'Service-Centric Business Model in Cloud Environment' | Page 1, Section I: 'Under the influence of technology trends, most importantly cloud computing, current organizational business models (BMs) are being questioned' | Page 1, Keywords: 'cloud environment'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the target customer type of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Section I: 'As the adoption of cloud services and cloud platforms takes hold, an enterprise tends to run its whole business in the cloud environment [3].' | Page 2, Section II: 'The BM as an enterprise's foundation is often used to describe the key components of an existing business [21]'

extracted_data.question_text: What are the customer acquisition channels of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_value: Direct sales

It implies a description of the services that organizations offer, or will offer, along with their related information about the nature of customer and market along with their preferences.'

extracted_data.question_text: Does the software business model presented in the article use cloud marketplaces or platforms?
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Section I: 'As the adoption of cloud services and cloud platforms takes hold, an enterprise tends to run its whole business in the cloud environment [3].' | Page 2, Section II: 'Cloud environment is a cloud computing based, cloud services or cloud platforms represented'

extracted_data.question_text: Which Business Model Canvas elements are detailed in the article about the software business model?
extracted_value: Value Proposition: Standardized service delivery and value-added services
Customer Segment: Individuals/groups who can access the cloud
Channels: Uniform online and offline channel based on cloud
Relationship: Long-term interaction with the life cycle of products or services
Revenue Streams: Value-driven revenue model
Key Resources: Distributed resources and capabilities
Key Activities: Well-integrated process
Key Partnerships: Value network with efficient coordination
Cost Structure: Operational expenditure
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 4, Table IV: 'FEATURES CHANGE ON DIFFERENT BUSINESS MODEL' showing detailed comparison between Previous BM and CBM across all nine building blocks | Page 4, Section III: 'The CBM expresses a more efficient and flexible way of doing business and can make enterprises create new revenue streams by enhancing and extending their value propositions, and improving and transforming industry value chains'

extracted_data.question_text: Which actors participate in the ecosystem of the software business model presented in the article and how do they interact?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Enterprises | Service provision and value creation | Provide standardized services and value-added services | Collaborate through value networks | Customers | Service consumption | Access cloud services | Receive value through service delivery | Partners | Resource sharing and collaboration | Share resources and capabilities | Participate in value network | Cloud providers | Infrastructure provision | Provide cloud platforms and services | Enable service delivery
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 4, Section III: 'The value network class describes social and technical resources transactions and operations within and between organizations towards the organizational framework in value configuration by a cross-organizational analysis perspective.' | Page 2, Section II: 'Ecosystem connectivity → Realizing multi-party cooperative and collaboration: Companies can facilitate collaboration with partners and customers, which can lead to improvements in productivity and increased innovation.'

extracted_data.question_text: What motivations lead to the adoption of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_value: Cost flexibility and optimized cost structure
Business scalability and efficient access to business capability
Market adaptability and quick response to market demands
Context-driven variability and intellectualization information processing
Ecosystem connectivity and multi-party cooperation
Resource optimization and efficient aggregation
Service standardization and servitization
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2, Table I: 'BUSINESS EVOLUTIONS ENABLED BY CLOUD' showing technological advantages and business evolutions | Page 2, Section II: 'The cloud becomes a mainstream in current the business ecosystem for organizations not only to enhance internal and external efficiencies and cost reduction, but also to target more strategic business capabilities.'

extracted_data.question_text: What factors contribute to the success of the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Cost flexibility → Optimized cost structure and reduced capital investment
Business scalability → Efficient access to business capability and elastic provisioning
Market adaptability → Quick response to market demands and new delivery channels
Ecosystem connectivity → Multi-party cooperation and collaboration
Service standardization → Standardized service delivery and value-added services
Resource optimization → Efficient aggregation and redistribution of resources
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2, Table I: 'BUSINESS EVOLUTIONS ENABLED BY CLOUD' showing how technological advantages enable business innovations | Page 2, Section II: 'These technological advantages enables firms' make several business innovations (see Table I) which are unreal under the limit of traditional IT solutions.'

extracted_data.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Cloud technological advantages → Business model innovation
Service standardization → Service delivery capability
Value network formation → Multi-party cooperation
Resource virtualization → Efficient resource utilization
Distributed computing → Resource aggregation and sharing
Internet/Web services → Multi-organizational coordination
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2, Section II: 'From the perspective of the relationship between IT and business operation, cloud has six essential technological advantages or cloud business enablers being used to power business model innovation [9].' | Page 3, Table III: 'INSPIRATIONS DERIVED FROM CLOUD BASIC TECHNIQUES' showing prerequisites from basic technologies

extracted_data.question_text: What restrictions or incompatibilities are mentioned in the article about the software business model?
extracted_value: Traditional IT limitations → Unreal business innovations
Product-centric approach → Limited service delivery
Fixed roles in supply chain → Inefficient coordination
Capital expenditure model → Higher initial costs
One-off transactions → Limited long-term value
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2, Section II: 'These technological advantages enables firms' make several business innovations (see Table I) which are unreal under the limit of traditional IT solutions.' | Page 4, Table IV: 'FEATURES CHANGE ON DIFFERENT BUSINESS MODEL' showing differences between Previous BM and CBM

extracted_data.question_text: What challenges are identified in implementing the software business model as presented in the article?
extracted_value: Business model evolution mechanism is still 'murky'
Unilateral understandings on BM evolution in cloud environment
Complex business ecosystem in cloud environment
Lack of consensus on BM conceptualization
Need to adapt existing business models to cloud environment
Complexity of value network coordination
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Section I: 'The BM evolution mechanism and the new BM conceptualization in cloud are still 'murky'. This murkiness could be because of the following three main reasons: 1)There are unilateral understandings on BM evolution in cloud environment by treating cloud computing as a new business model or an IT technology solution. 2)Studies on BM innovation of cloud service platform cannot completely reveals the evolution mechanism of BM in a complex business ecosystem in cloud environment. 3)The conceptualization of BM is not consensus.'

extracted_data.question_text: What practices are used to mitigate challenges of the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Ontological framework → Comprehensive understanding of business logic
Service-centric approach → Better service delivery and value creation
Value network formation → Efficient coordination and collaboration
Resource virtualization → Optimized resource utilization
Service standardization → Consistent service delivery
Systematic review → Better understanding of BM evolution
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 4, Section IV: 'The conceptualization of the CBM will make organizations to successfully understand value, service, and relative operation elements by detailing how it delivers products and services profitably and how it plans to do so in the long term.' | Page 1, Section I: 'Hence, a systematic review on the evolution of BM and the BMIs in cloud environment can help to further analyze element of new BM and conceptualize it with a comprehensible framework.'

extracted_data.question_text: What metrics and quantitative results are reported in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Study method; Deductive reasoning; Research approach; Case studies; Number of cases; 3; Companies studied; Webank, Haier, Suning; Industries; Financial, Manufacturing, Retail; Framework validation; Ontological framework; Research period; 2015
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Abstract: 'following a review of existing works and a series of case studies from several typical industries, employs a deductive reasoning method' | Page 7, Section V: 'companies from different industries in china are selected as the cases to be studied. First one is Webank, the internet banking for individuals and small medium enterprise (SME) with the online process of application, Identification, credit assessment, and loan based on cloud. Second is Haier, one of the biggest electronics product manufacturers, is providing specialized one-stop services and commercial manufacturing solutions recently. Last, Suning, which used to be one of the biggest electronics products retailers, has adapted its traditional BM in the cloud.'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1: '2015 IEEE International Conference on Services Computing' | Page 1, Section I: 'The cloud becomes a mainstream in current the business ecosystem for organizations'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the type of evidence presented in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Abstract: 'following a review of existing works and a series of case studies from several typical industries, employs a deductive reasoning method' | Page 7, Section V: 'companies from different industries in china are selected as the cases to be studied'

extracted_data.question_text: Which companies or products are cited as examples of the software business model in the article?
extracted_value: Webank → Internet banking for individuals and SMEs with online application, identification, credit assessment, and loan based on cloud
Haier → Electronics product manufacturer providing specialized one-stop services and commercial manufacturing solutions
Suning → Electronics products retailer that adapted its traditional business model in the cloud, now engaging in sale of electronic products, supply of services and commercial solutions
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 7, Section V: 'First one is Webank, the internet banking for individuals and small medium enterprise (SME) with the online process of application, Identification, credit assessment, and loan based on cloud. It represents a newly emerging BM in the field of financial world.' | Page 7, Section V: 'Second is Haier, one of the biggest electronics product manufacturers, is providing specialized one-stop services and commercial manufacturing solutions recently.' | Page 7, Section V: 'Last, Suning, which used to be one of the biggest electronics products retailers, has adapted its traditional BM in the cloud. Now, Suning professionally engages in the sale of electronic products, the supply of services and commercial solutions.'

extracted_data.question_text: Are there variations or subtypes of the software business model described in the article?
extracted_value: Cloud Manufacturing Platform → Manufacturing services through cloud
Cloud Supply Chain → Supply chain services through cloud
Cloud Business Intelligence → Business intelligence services through cloud
Service-Centric BM → Focus on service delivery and value creation
Value-Oriented BM → Focus on value creation and capture
Customer-Based BM → Focus on customer-centric approach
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Section I: 'Many studies have demonstrated convenient service-oriented BM of cloud service platforms (such as cloud manufacturing [11], cloud supply chain [12] and cloud business intelligent [13])' | Page 3, Section II: 'The aforementioned discusses indicate that the firm's product-centric BM is transforming into a service-centric, value-oriented, and customer-based BM along with the BM evolution in trends of the cloud and servitization application.'

extracted_data.question_text: What future trends or evolutions are mentioned in the article about the software business model?
extracted_value: Continued evolution from product-centric to service-centric business models
Expansion of cloud-enabled business ecosystems
Increased focus on value creation and service delivery
Development of more sophisticated value networks
Integration of cloud technologies with business model innovation
Growth of servitization and service-oriented approaches
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3, Section II: 'The CBM accelerates the appearance of the new networked business ecosystem and forces enterprises to redesign their existing business logics to improve their running businesses.' | Page 3, Section II: 'The aforementioned discusses indicate that the firm's product-centric BM is transforming into a service-centric, value-oriented, and customer-based BM along with the BM evolution in trends of the cloud and servitization application.' | Page 6, Section VI: 'The BM evolution mechanism and the ontological framework of cloud business model discussed in this paper will help stakeholders to improve their existing BMs for adapting the business logics in the cloud environment.'
